Jackson Eshbaugh

Jackson Eshbaugh

I study computer science and French at Lafayette College, where I focus on machine learning interpretability and multilingual NLP. My work explores how artificial systems understand language, and how we can make those systems more transparent, inclusive, and useful across disciplines.

Interpreting models, embracing language, bridging disciplines.
About Me My Research My Teaching Résumé Get in Touch

Subscribe

  • Jackson Eshbaugh
  • eshbaugj@lafayette.edu

Jackson Eshbaugh is a computer science and French student at Lafayette College in Easton, PA. His work centers on machine learning interpretability, multilingual natural language processing, and programming languages. He is especially passionate about applying computer science across disciplines—connecting language, biology, and education through code.
